intro: Clidemia urticifolia, commonly known as stinging nettle plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant has a hairy stem and leaves that can cause a stinging sensation when touched, similar to the stinging nettle. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in forest understories. Clidemia urticifolia is also known for its ability to form dense thickets, which can impact local ecosystems.
